headline: Terrible Teens: When the T. Rex Was A Juvenile Delinquent
abstract: Fossils that some scientists thought to be a separate species were likely adolescent Tyrannosaurus rexes, a new study says.
lead_paragraph: A full-grown T. rex was probably the most fearsome sight of the Cretaceous: It stood two stories tall, stretched the length of a city bus and boasted jaws that could crush the bones of a triceratops.
